reviews.review_msg: Dr. Wright is amazing! He genuinely cares about his students, course materials are extremely organized, and consistent and engaging in his teaching style. Probably one of the best profs I met in psych department

Lectures were long-winded (often without breaks) and Dr. Wright regularly was not able to finish the slides in time. Attendance was mandatory and audio recordings were only accessible with permission. HUGE disparity of marking between TAs and little feedback was given (if any). The content was valuable, but the class design was frustrating.
You have to, have to! stay on top of your essays and take notes during the lecture as it will be your guide to a great mark

Awful. Panders to the class with YouTube clips to 'entertain' rather than teach, makes us dumb down our papers into layman's terms, and the entire Intergroup Relations course was basically "LOOK! Look at how awful this particular racial group is & has been!!" while ignoring the fact that all major groups have a history of racism.
Her lecture style is boring- just goes over the slides. She is completely unhelpful with after class questions. I would avoid this prof at all costs.

Appears to make the course more difficult that it actually is. For example, a C ranges from 64-75%. Concepts are simple, but exams require memorizing lots of detail. Lecture style is mundane, she reads straight off her powerpoint slides.

He is SOO BORING!! Do not go to his lectures, they are a waste of time and not necessary to do well in this class! He reads directly off the slides and talks very very very slowly. Takes about half an hour to get through one slide. Great for gpa boosting though!
